text: Mass hysteria or mass psychological illness is a phenomenon when a large group of people share a common emotion. This emotion can be positive, such as people being euphoric at a rock concert, or it can be negative, like after a great person or statesman died. It was first used by the Quarteerly Christian Spectator in 1830, to describe an outbreak of cholera.The Journal of Health Conducted by an Association of Physicians (1831) p. 180 == References == Category:Symptoms Category:Psychology Category:Human behavior
